intro: Lophostachys cyanea, commonly known as the blue leaved lophostachys, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking blue-green foliage and produces small, delicate white flowers. The plant is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique coloration makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. It is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
